p: An emerging fermentation technique that consists of mixed cultures can be of particular interest. A mixed culture of Lactobacillus acidophilus and Lactobacillus plantarum resulted more effective than fermentation of the individual strains in eliminating phytic acid and trypsin inhibitors in cowpea. Similarly, a mixed culture of Streptococcus thermophilus and Bifidobacterium infantis dramatically decreased phytic acid and saponin levels in soy. It was further found that a mixed Saccharomyces boulardii and Lactobacillus plantarum fermentation increased calcium bioavailability approximately six-fold compared to the mono-culture fermentation [ 47]. On another note, Spirulina ( Arthrospira platensis) is reported to contain calcium as high as 180% compared to milk [ 57], which can also be potentially used to increase calcium intake ( Table 2).
